column1: Progeria is a rare genetic condition that produces rapid aging in children.
It is remarkable because its symptoms strongly resemble normal human aging, but it occurs in young children.

Symptoms include: - Growth failure during the first year of life - Narrow, shrunken or wrinkled face - Baldness - Loss of eyebrows and eyelashes - Short stature - Large head for size of face (macrocephaly) - Open soft spot (fontanelle) - Small jaw (micrognathia) - Dry, scaly, thin skin - Limited range of motion - Teeth - delayed or absent formation
The health care provider will perform a physical exam and order laboratory tests.
Genetic testing can detect changes in the gene (LMNA) that causes progeria.
Aspirin and statin medicines may be used to protect against a heart attack or stroke.
